title: Tension grips remote hamlet in A.P.’s Sathya Sai district, after a minor girl reported ‘pregnant’
content: Senior police personnel who visited the village launched an investigation to determine the facts behind the incident and identify those responsible.

title: 26/11 Mumbai terror attack: Delhi court extends Tahawwur Rana's judicial custody till July 9
content: Tahawwur Rana was brought to India after the U.S. Supreme Court on April 4 dismissed his review plea against his extradition to India

title: Political row brews over Bakrid holiday in Kerala
content: Indian Union Muslim League accuses Kerala government of attempting to implement ‘communal agenda and fascism’ in the State

title: Former Bengaluru top cop slams Karnataka government for Dayananda’s suspension
content: A day after Bengaluru stampede, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had on June 5, 2025, suspended Mr. Dayananda and all police officials responsible for the jurisdiction near Chinnaswamy stadium.

title: New Himalayan bat blurs India-Pakistan divide
content: The Himalayan long-tailed myotis recorded in Uttarakhand matched the unidentified find of a Hungarian scientist from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa in 1998

title: 17 more people evacuated from north Sikkim as rescue operations resume
content: The state government has arranged buses to transport the rescued people from the airport to Gangtok from where they would leave for their onward destinations, the official said.

title: Satyendar Jain appears before ACB for questioning in classroom construction case
content: Before leaving for the ACB office, Mr. Jain had asserted that the previous AAP government in the national capital worked towards improving the city's education, while the current BJP government was only doing politics.

title: Karnataka Cabinet condoles death of 11 in stampede at RCB victory celebrations in Bengaluru
content: On June 5, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah chaired a Cabinet meeting and took stock of the developments in the aftermath of the stampede

title: KSCA officials move High Court, seek quashing of FIR in stampede case
content: On June 6 morning, four officials of RCB and DNA entertainment were taken into custody, police sources said.

title: Telangana Cabinet to meet twice a month to accelerate policy implementation; earlier met once in 2-3 months
content: The Chief Minister is of the view that frequent cabinet meetings would allow ministers to engage in ongoing reviews and make necessary corrections and interventions in real-time

title: PM Modi visits Chenab bridge in J&K; interacts with engineers, workers
content: Accompanied by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Jitendra Singh and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, the Prime Minister visited a railway museum set up near the iconic bridge

title: Thennala Balakrishna Pillai, veteran Congress leader and former KPCC president, passes away
content: Bolstered by his reputation for honesty and non-partisanship, Thennala Balakrishna Pillai proved effective in managing factional undercurrents in Congress in Kerala

title: Rise in repatriation sign of mature market: RBI Governor on moderation in net FDI
content: The moderation in net FDI "is on account of a rise in repatriation and net outward FDI, while gross FDI actually increased by 14 per cent," Mr. Malhotra said, while unveiling the June monetary policy.

title: Assam flood situation remains bleak, over 5.6 lakh affected
content: Wildlife has also been affected with nearly 70% of the Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary in Morigaon district facing inundation, an official said

title: Don’t like women wearing short clothes, says M.P. Minister Vijayvargiya at Indore event
content: Kailash Vijayvargiya made the remarks while comparing short speeches of leaders with the short clothes of women

title: 'Rajnath Aam': New mango variety named after Defence Minister
content: Kalimullah Khan, who has earlier named mango varieties after several prominent Indian personalities, was awarded the Padma Shri for his unique contributions and dedication to horticulture and fruit breeding

title: Madras High Court refuses to order re-conduct of NEET-UG 2025 for candidates affected by power outage
content: Justice C. Kumarappan says, nearly 22 lakh candidates had appeared for the test this year and hence, any such order would seriously affect the level playing field

title: PM Modi lauds Yuva Shakti for driving India’s growth

title: Man who raped toddler near Lucknow metro station killed in police encounter
content: Late Thursday, June 5, police received information that the accused was about to flee. A team reached the spot and tried to stop him, but the accused opened fire, a police officer claimed.

title: Kashmir rail link example of continuity in governance which PM never acknowledges: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh said governance involves great continuity, "a fact consistently denied by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his perennial desire for self-glory".

title: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko’s father killed in accident in Tamil Nadu; actor, mother injured
content: According to the Palacode police, the accident occurred near Palayur, and the car is said to have crashed into a lorry that was ahead

title: Properties of rape accused razed in Bihar, locals dub it 'bulldozer justice model'
content: The accused, who had been dodging the police, has surrendered. Further action will be taken as per directions of the court, says Vidya Sagar, SP (Rural) Muzaffarpur

title: PM Modi J&K visit LIVE: PM Modi flags off Katra-Srinagar Vande Bharat Express
content: Vande Bharat service to Srinagar to begin June 7; Chenab and Anji Khad bridges hailed as engineering marvels; ₹46,000 crore worth projects to be launched

title: Bengaluru stampede: Top RCB official and 3 from event management company arrested
content: The arrests came hours after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced at a press conference the suspension of city police commissioner B. Dayananda and directed police to arrest RCB and the KSCA for the stampede.

title: Hindi speakers’ society takes the lead to celebrate centenary of Ritwik Ghatak
content: On June 8, Paschim Banga Hindi Bhashi Samaj (West Bengal Hindi Speakers’ Society), will hold a screening of Ghatak’s film Subarnarekha

title: Judge, jury and torturer: A flagrant case of police highhandedness in A.P.’s Tenali
content: The recent incident of two police personnel beating up three youth in Guntur’s Tenali in public to ‘teach them a lesson’ for allegedly attacking a constable in Andhra underscores the need to establish robust mechanisms of accountability to ensure all individuals in conflict with the law are treated justly and with dignity, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Andhra Pradesh reports 19 new COVID cases in a day
content: This is the biggest 24-hour jump in the State since the first case was reported from Visakhapatnam on May 20; active caseload now stands at 50

title: A museum in search of a forever home in Telangana
content: A rare private collection of tribal instruments and totemic relics gathered from across Telangana over five decades by ethnographer Jayadheer Tirumala Rao have long searched for a permanent address. When Osmania University, Hyderabad, finally offered space, student protests stopped the move. Now, caught between legacy and land politics, the museum’s future hangs in the balance. Serish Nanisetti traces the journey

title: 3-year-old girl sleeping under metro station in Uttar Pradesh raped, in critical condition
content: The accused took the girl away while her parents were sleeping and raped her at a secluded place, police said

title: Malnad farmers, planters struggle to weather the storm
content: From droughts to early monsoons to heavier-than-usual pre- and post-monsoon rains, vagaries of the weather in Karnataka’s high rainfall regions are altering farming timelines and yields, find K.C. Deepika and Sathish G.T.

title: J&K: Security forces conduct inspections in Ramban ahead of PM Modi's visit to Katra
content: Security personnel conducted sweeping inspections, including dog squad deployments and comprehensive vehicle checks. Security was also heightened at the Udhampur Railway Station

title: KTR helps bring body of BRS worker who died in Saudi Arabia
content: Babya, a BRS worker and farmer, had left for Saudi Arabia a year ago for a job. He succumbed to a heart attack on May 27

title: India's multi-party delegation holds 'comprehensive' discussions with U.S. Vice-President Vance
content: The conversation focused on strengthening the India-U.S. partnership, including cooperation in counter-terrorism domain, says the Indian Embassy in the U.S in a post on X

title: Karnataka launches district officers’ upskilling initiative with Infosys partnership
content: Sharan Prakash Patil, Minister for Medical Education, Skill Development, Entrepreneurship & Livelihood, inaugurated the programme through videoconferencing from the Vikasa Soudha

title: YSRCP demands probe into ‘irregularities’ in SSC exam evaluation
content: The YSRCP student wing criticised the government, holding Mr. Lokesh directly responsible for gross mismanagement in the evaluation of answer scripts.

title: Monsoon: Gear up to tackle any eventuality, says Chief Secretary
content: Mr. Vijayanand said in the event of cyclones, heavy rains and floods, efforts should be made to minimise the loss of property and lives, and establish normal conditions promptly

title: Citing ‘unjust racial discrimination’, Trump grants asylum to White Afrikaners
content: The decision to grant asylum to white Afrikaners comes on the heels of the Trump administration halting other refugee admissions from war-torn countries such as DR Congo, Myanmar, Afghanistan, and Palestine

title: A.P. govt. sets target to increase green cover to 50% by 2047
content: CM Naidu and Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan launch one-crore tree plantation drive; plans afoot to plant 5.58 crore saplings by the World Environment Day next year

title: Supriya Sule could not sign letter for special Parliament sessions, urges Congress to wait
content: Supriya Sule has urged the opposition leaders to wait with their demands of special session of Parliament to discuss Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor until the multi-party delegations return from various countries

title: NHRC notice to Madhya Pradesh over assault of two journalists by police
content: The journalists were manhandled, allegedly, under the supervision of the District Superintendent of Police, on May 1, 2025

title: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway now operational, cuts travel time by 10 hours
content: The road will open up new avenues since 24 districts of Maharashtra have now been connected with JNPT port and will soon be connected to Vadhavan port

title: On a wing and a prayer
content: The CSIR-National Aerospace Laboratories has, for nearly three decades, worked on perfecting the two-seater Hansa aircraft for commercial manufacture. This year, it has inked a deal with a private company that will manufacture the planes. Jacob Koshy explores why despite having research capabilities, India is still struggling to manufacture training aircraft

title: Security forces launch operation along India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh
content: “While moving through the thick forest, the patrol observed the movement of unknown individuals. In response, the patrol drew heavy and indiscriminate fire from heavy-calibre weapons, which was effectively retaliated by the security forces,” according to the Defence Ministry.

title: Ram Temple moves towards completion, idol of ‘Raja Ram’ consecrated
content: While Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the top government brass and a host of celebrities were present at the consecration of Ram Lalla, the child god, on January 22, 2024, the event this time was quieter

title: Stalin hands over appointment orders to 1,304 forest staff
content: An event to celebrate World Environment Day was organised by the Departments of Environment, Climate Change, and Forests

title: Railways to undertake random verification of Aadhaar to check for illegal immigrants
content: Railway Board has said instances of individuals staying unauthorisedly in India with fake or forged Aadhaar cards and using them as proof of identity for various purposes, including employment and travel, have come to notice

title: Police officers told not to post photos in uniform on social media
content: Move after some officers attended private functions in uniform and even shared sensitive information

title: State to rollout Coco policy soon
content: CM Naidu reviews crop procurement plans; pushes for maintaining global standards in cocoa, mango, and tobacco farming

title: People’s convention demands conservation of KAU’s model jackfruit farm
content: Participants tie ribbons to each jackfruit tree, embrace them, and form human chain of protection, followed by an environmental pledge to preserve the farm

title: Tamil translation of Madhav Gadgil’s autobiography A Walk Up the Hill launched
content: Prof. Gadgil recalled his long association with Tamil Nadu that began in 1973 when he started work in the Nilgiris and subsequently in Mudumalai Tiger Reserve

title: Vembanad’s clam sector plumbs new depths
content: The Vembanad Lake ecosystem and clam fishery are facing an unprecedented crisis. The deteriorating water quality and plummeting clam production have hit the lives of a large number of people who once survived on clam fishery. Hiran Unnikrishnan and Sam Paul A. find out what is worrying the ecologists as well as fishers of the region

title: Maturity shown by political parties amid Indo-Pak tension should continue to ensure nation’s security, growth: RSS chief
content: Terming conversion as “violence”, RSS Chief says that the Sangh never supports change of religion done out of force or greed, adding that those who want to “come back” must be respected

title: Commissioner failed to reject permission for revelry in writing: Karnataka government
content: The office of Police Commissioner failed to give a written reply to the RCB organisers about rejecting the permission on the grounds of lack of time to prepare for such a huge event, said the suspension order of the Commissioner of Police and four other officers

title: Seemanth Kumar Singh is new Bengaluru city police chief
content: Mr. Singh, presently posted as Additional Director-General of Police, Bengaluru Metropolitan Task Force, will replace B. Dayananda

title: Bengaluru stampede: ‘Everything that could go wrong, went wrong’
content: According to police sources, a perfect storm of circumstances converged to trigger one of the most tragic incidents in the nation’s cricketing history—the Bengaluru stampede

title: Minister of State L. Murugan meets Vietnamese delegation
content: India and Vietnam strengthen media and entertainment cooperation, highlighting deep civilisational connections and strong bilateral relations

title: In a first, girl from tribal community in Kalvarayan Hills earns her seat in IIT
content: A. Rajeshwari,  a student of the Government Tribal Residential Higher Secondary School in Karumandurai, has ranked 417 in the Scheduled Tribe category in JEE (Advanced) 2025

title: MSME parks set to industrialise Andhra Pradesh big time, says Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
content: The government is striving to attract entrepreneurs to invest in the State by offering them tailor-made incentives and extending the required support, and the efforts are paying off, he says

title: Diplomacy is about ‘incrementalism’, says Congress leader Manish Tewari

title: M.K. Alagiri’s supporters seek re-entry into DMK
content: DMK president and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin recently visiting his elder brother’s house when he was visiting Madurai in connection with the party’s general council meeting

title: Trinamool leader Anubrata Mondal appears before police; NCW seeks report on ‘abusive’ audio
content: In the viral audio, Anubrata Mondal is heard making derogatory remarks at a police officer’s wife and mother; despite an FIR registered against Mondal, he has not been arrested

title: Pakistan likes to dangle nuclear bogey to get the world excited, Tharoor says in Washington
content: Congress MP dismisses questions on approaching nuclear threshold during recent India-Pakistan conflict

title: More ‘resources and efforts’ required to nurture India-Central Asia links: S. Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlights the need for intensifying trade through the port of Chabahar in Iran; he further expresses support for ‘mutual settlement of trade’ in national currencies

title: As Lavrov plans India visit, Putin aide ruffles feathers by repeating Trump claim on mediation
content: Mr. Lavrov would be first FM from a UNSC permanent member nation to visit India since Operation Sindoor; expected to discuss strategic ties and the India-Eurasia FTA, which has been in negotiations since 2015

title: Maharashtra government cancels approvals for 903 projects
content: Schemes that are not operational due to land acquisition issues, local opposition, or lack of cooperation from contractors will be cancelled to prevent misallocation of funds

title: ‘Malai koothu’ has evolved, but there’s not much in the art form for ‘koothadi’
content: ‘Malai koothu’, a form of ‘therukoothu’, is culturally moored in the lives of the Malaiyali tribes of Dharmapuri and the Javadhu and Yelagiri Hills in Tirupathur. But the artists have to strike a balance between the pleasure of pursuit of an art form that caters to an already poor audience and making a living through other jobs

title: A pillar and a peak that are held most sacred by the Irula tribe
content: Members of this community celebrate the harvest from their millet land in May and June. They perform pujas for five weeks praying to the deity for another good harvest. More recently, the festival has become popular among non-adivasi members too

title: From prison to printing press: legacy of Kudiarasu, first journal Periyar published
content: In the early 1920s, Periyar, a prominent member of the Indian National Congress, was jailed in Coimbatore for leading a protest. There, he envisioned a publication that would speak “unflinching truths to power”. The result was a weekly that became not only a mouthpiece of the Self-Respect Movement but also a platform for challenging social evils

title: 'Resilient': Haliburton's late shot sinks OKC in G1
content: Tyrese Haliburton scored with 0.3 left for Indiana's first and only lead of the game and the Pacers beat the Thunder 111-110 in Game 1 of the NBA Finals.

title: OKC on Game 1 collapse: 'We've been here before'
content: After Thursday night's dramatic loss, the Thunder pointed to their collapse against the Nuggets in Round 2 as proof they can bounce back from heartbreaking Game 1 setbacks.

title: QB Rodgers agrees to 1-year deal with Steelers
content: QB Aaron Rodgers agreed to terms on a one-year deal with the Steelers, the team announced on Thursday night.

title: Canady's 'huge' outing lifts TTU to G2 win over UT
content: NiJaree Canady scattered six hits and pitched her way out of a seventh-inning jam, and Texas Tech forced a decisive third game in the Women's College World Series with a 4-3 victory over Texas on Thursday night.

title: Silver: Owners likely to urge exploring expansion
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said he believes there is enough interest among league owners to begin "a more formal exploratory phase" of expansion.

title: BYU signs Young to extension after first year
content: BYU coach Kevin Young has signed a new long-term contract extension with the program, the team announced on Thursday.

content: Kierston Russell, the twin sister of Alabama freshman quarterback Keelon Russell, died Wednesday, according to a statement from Tuscaloosa police officials.

title: 'No sir': Ravens asst. Pagano done with being HC
content: Former Colts head coach Chuck Pagano, who ended his four-year retirement to become an assistant with the Ravens, says he has no desire to be an NFL head coach again.

content: The Steelers finally landed Rodgers after months of anticipation. But can the move actually improve the offense? Let's grade the signing.

content: This year is the second NBA Finals in which both participants are on title droughts that exceed 40 years.

content: The coach knows he's going to lose players each year to power conference programs. He's finding ways to win anyway.

content: Aaron Rodgers is headed to the Steelers, but expectations of a return to fantasy greatness should be tempered.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal keen on Kepa and Karetsas
content: Arsenal want Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, and are tracking Greece midfield prodigy Konstantinos Karetsas. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids Actor Dino Morea's Mumbai Home In Mithi River Controversy
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is conducting raids at actor Dino Moreas Mumbai house in the Mithi River money laundering case.

title: NDTV Exclusive: How Rs 5 Indian Biscuit Is Being Sold For Rs 2,400 In Gaza
content: Parle-G biscuits, a staple in Indian households, associated with childhood and low-cost nutrition, were never intended to be a luxury. But in wartorn Gaza, where food scarcity has turned into acute famine, they are being sold at record prices.

title: Donald Trump Says Elon Musk Has "Trump Derangement Syndrome". What It Means
content: In the middle of what's been a never-seen-before public fallout between arguably two of the most powerful men in the world, US President Donald Trump said that billionaire Elon Musk was suffering from "Trump derangement syndrome."

title: Elon Musk's Big "Dragon" Warning After Trump Threat, Then A U-Turn
content: Billionaire Elon Musk, who has been publicly feuding with US President Donald Trump, on Friday announced the immediate "decommissioning" of SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft that is used by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

title: Top RCB Official Among 4 Arrested By Bengaluru Cops Over Deadly Stampede
content: The Bengaluru police have made four arrests over the stampede that claimed 11 lives during the RCB victory celebration at the M Chinnaswamy stadium on Wednesday.

title: Raj Thackeray's Son On What's Necessary For Patch-Up With Estranged Uncle
content: MNS leader Amit Thackeray has said that alliances do not happen by making statements before the media and asserted that party chief Raj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray should talk to each other for any possibility of a rapprochement.

title: In A First, No Message By Akhal Takht Leader On Op Blue Star Anniversary
content: For the first time during the anniversary of Operation Blue Star, the acting Jathedar of Akal Takht, the highest temporal body of Sikhs, Kuldeep Singh Gargaj, did not deliver the customary message to the Sikh community.

title: Decoding Rahul Gandhi's "Horse" Analogy For Congress's Revival
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's use of horses as examples to differentiate between workers and leaders who are working hard for the party and those who are deadwood has drawn criticism as well as ridicule on social media.

title: Railway Minister Shares 8 Features Of Katra Srinagar Rail Link

title: Kashmir Gets Mega Rail Link: A Look At Key Stations And Their Significance
content: More than two dozen railway stations, including Reasi, Katra, Banihal, Qazigund, Sangaldan and Budgam, have made transportation easy, connecting the Kashmir Valley with other major cities.

title: Poland's Foreign Minister Mocks Elon Musk After His Feud With Trump
content: Poland's foreign minister Radoslaw Sikorski poked fun at Elon Musk late on Thursday, returning to a social media spat from March after the Tesla and SpaceX boss spectacularly fell out with US President Donald Trump.

title: Trinamool's Mahua Moitra Marries Ex-MP Pinaki Misra, Posts This Tweet
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra, known for her fiery speeches in the Parliament, married former Biju Janata Dal (BJD) parliamentarian Pinaki Mishra.

title: PM Modi's Big Kashmir Push, Weeks After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: In his first visit to Jammu and Kashmir since the Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, which left 26 people dead, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will today inaugurate key infrastructure projects that will reshape Kashmir's connectivity and economy.

title: Chenab Bridge Opens: Why It Was India's Biggest Engineering Challenge
content: The Chenab bridge, the world's highest railway bridge, is among the key infrastructure projects inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi today in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: How Donald Trump Became Elon Musk's 'X'
content: Musk's and Trump's insults at each other peaked as Trump threatened to cut government contracts for Musk and the latter claimed that the Trump administration had not released the records related to Jeffrey Epstein because Trump is mentioned in them.

title: Shashi Tharoor On 3 Reasons Why Pak Can't Hide Its Link With Terror
content: Shashi Tharoor has given three reasons why Pakistan can't deny its involvement in the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists. Mr Tharoor was responding to a question during a discussion hosted by a US think tank when he gave the three points.

title: Amazon Cuts Jobs In Books Division, Including Goodreads And Kindle Units
content: Amazon has cut jobs in its books division, including at its Goodreads review site and Kindle units, the company said on Thursday.

title: RBI Surprises With Double Rate Cut Than Expected: What It Means For EMIs
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has slashed its key lending rate, or the repo rate, by 50 basis points to 5.5% as inflation softens within its comfort level.

title: Stoning The Devil: Hajj Concludes As Muslim Pilgrims Perform Last Ritual
content: Starting at dawn, the more than 1.6 million Muslims taking part in the pilgrimage will throw seven stones at each of three concrete walls symbolising the devil in the Mina valley, on the outskirts of the holy city of Mecca.

title: The Promise And Peril Of A Crewed Mars Mission
content: Mars mission would pursue scientific objectives like determining whether Mars ever hosted life and charting the evolution of its surface, as well as answering broader questions -- such as the history of the Sun through studying Martian soil.

title: Meghalaya murder: CCTV shows couple leaving hotel; wife missing, husband later found dead
content: CCTV footage shows an Indore couple checking out of a Meghalaya hotel before their disappearance. Raja Raghuvanshi's body was found in a gorge, murdered with a machete. His brother believes Sonam is alive and abducted, urging authorities to investigate accordingly as the search continues and the motive remains unclear.

title: RBI MPC meet: FD rates set to fall after repo rate cut; what should investors do?
content: The Reserve Bank of India has significantly reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, accompanied by a 1% decrease in the Cash Reserve Ratio, injecting substantial liquidity into the banking system. While borrowers can anticipate cheaper loans, fixed deposit investors face the prospect of declining interest rates.

title: 41 victims, 110 accounts: Ex-ICICI bank employee stole crores; here's how she fooled everyone
content: Sakshi Gupta, a former bank relationship manager in Kota, has been arrested for allegedly siphoning off over Rs 4.58 crore from customer accounts between 2020 and 2023. She accessed over 110 accounts, redirected funds into stock market investments, and concealed the fraud by changing mobile numbers linked to the accounts.

title: Smartphone wars: Steve Ballmer may have agreed with Android co-founder; Gates cost Microsoft $400B
content: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer acknowledged that overconfidence in Windows led to the company's failure in the smartphone market. He admitted Microsoft tried forcing Windows into unsuitable areas like mobile and automotive, resulting in poor user experiences.

title: NEET PG 2025 exam date postponed to August 3, to be held in a single shift
content: The NEET PG 2025 exam has been postponed to August 3 following a Supreme Court extension granted to the National Board of Examinations. The court directed the exam be held in a single shift to ensure fairness and transparency. NBEMS announced the delay to expand test centres and upgrade infrastructure. The Supreme Court rejected NBE’s two-shift plan citing arbitrariness and mandated no further extensions. This ensures a level playing field for all candidates, as reported by ANI.

title: Yash Dayal: 'Whatever is done for Virat (Kohli) bhaiya is very less'
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) pacer Yash Dayal, in a free-wheeling chat with TimesofIndia.com, has opened up about winning the IPL trophy, burying the Ahmedabad ghost, explaining why he feels Virat Kohli deserves more, and the learnings from Josh Hazlewood. Dayal took 13 wickets for RCB and forged one of the strongest pace attacks with Josh Hazlewood and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in IPL 2025.

title: Elon’s ex Ashley joins Trump-Musk spat makes offer to US President; says 'if you...'
content: Ashley St. Clair, claiming to be a mother of Elon Musk's child, offered Donald Trump "breakup advice" amidst their escalating feud sparked by Musk's claims of influencing the 2024 election. St. Clair alleges Musk offered her hush money regarding their child, while Trump dismissed Musk's influence and criticized his business interests.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Cleaning staff collect 150 bags of footwear stained with dried blood
content: The Chinnaswamy Stadium bore witness to a tragic scene following a chaotic event, with cleaning staff discovering around 150 bags of discarded footwear, some stained with blood. Workers recounted the harrowing experience, describing the scene as a 'war zone,' particularly disturbed by children's footwear.

title: RBI MPC meet: Why repo rate was cut by larger-than-expected 50 basis points; governor explains
content: In a surprise move, the RBI slashed the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, exceeding expectations. This decision, driven by a lower projected inflation rate of 3.7% and a need to boost domestic growth, aims to reduce home loan EMIs and stimulate consumer spending.

title: ‘I don’t like women in revealing dresses’: MP minister likens clothing to morality
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Kailash Vijayvargiya sparked controversy with his remarks about women's clothing, stating he dislikes women who wear revealing clothes and refuses to take photos with them. This isn't the first time he's made such comments, having previously compared women in "bad dresses" to a demoness from the Ramayana.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 'Where is Rohit Sharma?': Pant jokes at airport; Indian team departs for ENG
content: Rishabh Pant, India's vice-captain, expressed that he will miss Rohit Sharma in the upcoming Test series against England, which begins on June 20, 2025. This series marks India's first bilateral Test series since the retirement of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Shubman Gill will captain the team, and India aims to win their first Test series in England since 2007.

title: 'Shouldn't be allowed': Shashi Tharoor answers son's question at US press briefing
content: In a surprising moment, Shashi Tharoor was questioned by his son, Ishaan Tharoor of the Washington Post, during a foreign policy address. Ishaan inquired about evidence of Pakistan's involvement in the Pahalgam attack. Tharoor responded that India possessed convincing evidence before conducting Operation Sindoor. He highlighted Pakistan's history of denying involvement in terror attacks, citing the Mumbai attacks.

title: NBA: Payton makes bold claim about Jordan; say season’s Finals could go the distance
content: Gary Payton anticipates an exciting 2025 NBA Finals. He highlights the defensive prowess of both Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers. Payton emphasizes the importance of containing star players like Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Tyrese Haliburton. He predicts a potentially long series. Payton also expresses his preference for a more defense-oriented style of basketball.

title: Trump vs Harvard: US judge puts temporary hold on foreign student ban
content: A US court has temporarily blocked President Trump's proclamation that aimed to prevent international students from entering the US to study at Harvard University. Harvard filed a legal petition, arguing the directive was unlawful retribution for the university's opposition to White House requirements. The university's president, Alan M. Garber, stated the proclamation circumvents a previous court order.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 24,900; BSE Sensex jumps over 700 points
content: Indian stock market experienced a surge following the Reserve Bank of India's unexpected 50 basis points repo rate cut, bringing it to a three-year low of 5.5% to stimulate economic growth. The BSE Sensex climbed significantly, while the Nifty50 also saw gains.

title: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko injured in road accident; father dies on spot
content: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko's father, CP Chacko, tragically died in a car accident near Palacode in Dharmapuri district while traveling to Bengaluru for a medical check-up. The car, carrying Shine Tom Chacko and his family, collided with a stationary truck, resulting in fatal injuries for the actor's father.

title: 7 signs of magnesium deficiency seen in face and eyes
content: Magnesium deficiency can manifest in various facial and eye-related symptoms. These include eye twitching, puffy eyes, dark circles, facial muscle cramps, dry skin, dull eyes, and mouth twitching. Addressing this deficiency through diet, supplements, and lifestyle adjustments can alleviate these symptoms and improve overall health by restoring magnesium levels.

title: Elon Musk’s Epstein tweet about Donald Trump sparks wild Antonio Brown reaction
content: Elon Musk ignited a social media firestorm by accusing Donald Trump of being linked to the Epstein files. Shortly after, Antonio Brown, the former NFL player, injected his signature chaos into the situation with a bizarre tweet suggesting Trump should deport Musk to South Africa. Brown's unexpected commentary quickly grabbed attention, proving his knack for viral moments remains strong.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Who is Nikhil Sosale, the arrested RCB official
content: Following a tragic stampede during RCB's IPL victory celebrations that resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries, Bengaluru Police have arrested Nikhil Sosale, RCB's marketing head, and three individuals from DNA Entertainment Networks.

title: 30+ Best Eid Mubarak messages to share with family & friends on Eid-ul-Adha 2025
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 is approaching, a time for families and communities to unite in celebration of sacrifice, compassion, and faith. Sending heartfelt wishes and messages strengthens bonds and spreads the spirit of the occasion. This collection of Eid Mubarak greetings offers ways to express love and blessings to family and friends, fostering joy and togetherness during this significant Islamic festival.

title: CG PET 2025 result declared; Ayush Patle tops with 127 marks
content: The Chhattisgarh Professional Examination Board (CG PEB) has declared the CG PET 2025 result on June 6. Ayush Patle topped the exam with 127 marks. A total of 12,276 candidates were included in the merit list. The final answer key has been released, with four questions dropped from the paper. Results are available at vyapam.cgstate.gov.in. The exam was conducted on May 8 for admission to various BE, BTech, and DDT programmes across the state.

title: Top RCB official, 3 event firm staffers arrested by Bengaluru cops over stampede
content: Following a tragic stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 fatalities and 75 injuries during victory celebrations, Bengaluru police have arrested RCB's marketing head Nikhil Sosale and three executives from DNA Entertainment Networks. The arrests, directed by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, target those deemed responsible for the incident. Authorities are also searching for KSCA secretary Shankar A.

title: Larger-than-expected surprise: RBI cuts repo rate by 50 bps to 5.5%; EMIs to come down
content: RBI MPC Meeting: In a move to boost loan access, the RBI has slashed the repo rate by 50 basis points, bringing it down to 5.5%. This marks a cumulative 100 basis point reduction since February. While the RBI signals limited room for further cuts by shifting to a 'neutral' stance, this decision arrives amidst a backdrop of India's robust 7.

title: Musk vs Trump: Did Vivek Ramaswamy 'Doge' a bullet?
content: As the Trump-Musk bromance dissolves faster than a Tesla on Autopilot in Washington traffic, one man watches the fireworks from a safe, well-lit distance—sipping Perrier, adjusting his campaign blazer, and thanking his stars he got out early, having clearly absorbed Sun Tzu’s timeless wisdom: “The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”—Vivek Ramaswamy.

title: Watch: Indian cricket team departs for England; heralds start of new era
content: The Indian cricket team has departed for England to participate in a five-match Test series, marking the beginning of a new era following the retirement of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from Test cricket. Shubman Gill will lead the team, which includes both seasoned players and fresh talent.

title: ‘Her laptop is still on office table’: Bengaluru techie dream ends in grief
content: Devi, a devoted RCB fan from Tamil Nadu working in Bengaluru, eagerly sought permission to attend the team's victory parade. Despite missing online ticket availability, she optimistically headed to the stadium. Tragically, her friends received a call from the hospital, marking the last communication and leaving them with the heartbreaking task of informing her parents.

title: Feud intensifies: Musk shares 1992 video; Trump seen with Jeffrey Epstein in clip
content: Elon Musk ignited a political controversy by sharing a video of Donald Trump with Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting hidden government files implicate the US president in Epstein's alleged crimes. This claim, made after Musk's departure from a White House advisory role, has fueled demands for the full release of Epstein documents.

title: Are banks open or closed on Eid al-Adha 2025? Check details
content: Indian banks will observe closures on June 6th and 7th, 2025, for Eid al-Adha, according to the RBI. Kerala banks will be closed on June 6th, while most banks nationwide will be closed on June 7th, except in a few cities. Despite the holiday, digital banking services will remain operational.

title: Trump-Musk rift widens: Elon warns tariffs could trigger 'US recession'
content: A public feud erupted between Donald Trump and Elon Musk after Musk warned that Trump's tariffs could trigger a recession. The two exchanged insults on social media, with Musk referencing Trump's alleged connection to Jeffrey Epstein. Trump criticized Musk's stance on his spending bill and threatened to terminate government contracts.

title: 'He was lying with clothes torn': RCB fan dies in Bengaluru amid IPL celebration chaos
content: A young college student, Bhoomik, tragically lost his life amidst the chaotic celebrations at Chinnaswamy Stadium. Separated from his friends in the crowd, he was found injured and unresponsive. His parents believe that quicker medical assistance could have saved him, but delays caused by the chief minister's visit further compounded their grief and delayed the release of his body.

title: 'JD Vance understood': Shashi Tharoor in US says 'India won the narrative
content: Shashi Tharoor said that US vice president JD Vance understands the impossibility of mediating between India and Pakistan, as it would imply an equivalence between a victim and a terrorist. Tharoor highlighted India's strong diplomatic outreach, noting more meetings at higher levels compared to the Pakistani delegation. He also emphasised the unity within India regarding the issue of terrorism.

title: Norway Chess | Carlsen on losing against Gukesh: 'My tournament was over'
content: Reigning World Champion Gukesh is challenging World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament. Carlsen, with 15 points, is closely trailed by Gukesh at 14.5. Following a loss to Gukesh, a frustrated Carlsen expressed his disillusionment with classical chess, even hinting at quitting. Despite a win against Caruana, Carlsen admits the tournament's enjoyment diminished after the Gukesh game.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: 'Stop looking for a body, wife Sonam has been kidnapped'
content: The search for Sonam Raghuvanshi, missing since May 22nd during her honeymoon in Meghalaya, continues as new CCTV footage places her and her husband Raja at a Shillong hotel. Raja was later found murdered, fueling fears that Sonam may have been abducted and trafficked across the border into Bangladesh.

title: Trump-Musk feud: Tesla stock price crash wipes out $150 bn; investors dump company
content: Tesla share price crash: A verbal clash between Elon Musk and Donald Trump triggered a Tesla share price crash, wiping out $150 billion from its market cap. Investors, who initially favored Tesla after Trump's election, grew concerned about potential regulatory hurdles for autonomous vehicles.

title: 'Drake vs Kendrick'': Internet turns Musk-Trump fallout into ‘Mean Girls’ memes
content: A public feud has erupted between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, triggered by disagreements over a government bill. Musk criticized the legislation, leading to Trump expressing disappointment and claiming he curtailed Musk's influence. The online fallout has been met with memes and comparisons to famous feuds, captivating social media users.

title: 'If we had known he was going to the stadium ... ': Shivalinga just passed Class 10 board exams
content: Seventeen-year-old Shivalinga, a Class 10 board exam pass-out, lost his life in the Bengaluru stampede after detouring to the stadium to see his favourite RCB players. A responsible son from a humble family, he was seen as their future. His devastated parents now grieve their loss, saying no compensation can replace the dreams they had for him.

title: Diddy's ex says initial 'passionate nights' opened 'Pandora's box'
content: A former romantic partner, identified as Jane, testified against Sean "Diddy" Combs, detailing how their consensual relationship evolved into coercive voyeuristic encounters. She described drug-influenced sexual situations with escorts in hotel rooms across the country, where Combs allegedly watched and engaged in self-gratification. Jane's testimony supports allegations of sex-trafficking and racketeering, adding to earlier accusations by Casandra Ventura.

title: Musk claims Trump 's name is in 'Epstein files'; how White House responded
content: Elon Musk ignited a feud with President Trump by alleging Trump's involvement in the Epstein files, prompting demands for their release. White House dismissed Musk's claims as stemming from dissatisfaction with the "One Big Beautiful Bill." Democrats seized on the allegation, urging transparency and questioning potential administration cover-ups.

title: Will punish guilty: Siddaramaiah on Karnataka minister's role in hurried celebration
content: Following a stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries during RCB's victory parade, the Karnataka government has suspended five senior Bengaluru police officers, including the police commissioner. CM Siddaramaiah ordered the arrest of top officials from RCB, DNA, and KSCA, alleging criminal mismanagement.

title: Meet the 2025 Boxing Hall of Fame class: Pacquiao, Paz, more
content: Manny Pacquiao is inducted to the international boxing Hall of Fame on sunday . the 46-year-old will reappear in a boxing ring after nearly four years out . he will take on Mario Barrios for the welterweight title on July 19 .

title: 2025 NBA Finals: How Haliburton and Indy stole Game 1
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander outplayed Tyrese Haliburton in a matchup of star point guards . he missed a clean midrange jumper, his specialty, that would have given the Thunder a three-point lead with 10 seconds left . the Pacers changed the narrative ... again .

content: vasiliy Lomachenko announced his retirement from boxing on friday at age 37 . he leaves the sport as a three-division world champion with a professional record of 18-3 (12 KOs) a new wave of fans will look at his record and ask how a fighter with three losses in only 21 fights can be considered great .

title: Steelers built for prime Rodgers, but instead get older QB with questionable skills
content: the Pittsburgh Steelers ' refrain of the spring was that they were going to conduct their offseason business independent of Rodgers' decision . the Steelers bypassed nearly every quarterback option before drafting Will Howard in the sixth round . they also opted to sign Mason Rudolph as their lone true veteran quarterback .

title: 💬 Social reaction to wild NBA Finals Game 1
content: the Pacers beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 111-110 in the NBA Finals . it is the latest game winner in a Finals game since Michael Jordan's in Game 1 . the 15-point comeback ties the largest fourth-quarter rally for a victory in the Finals over the past 50 years .
